ygData.subject: Re: Something fun to try
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, I ve never done it either, though I admit I would have been tempted to when I heard a friend howl complaints of someone a continent away.  Upon reading
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, I've never done it either, though I admit I would have been tempted to
when I heard a friend howl complaints of someone a continent away. Upon
reading your tale, it struck me: that troll should have just challenged a
member of your party to a duel, then felt self-righteous and superior when
no one was brave enough to take up the challenge.

Roop


>From: jay schultze <sartori69@...>
>
>Anyways, I am not guilty of ever doing this intentionally, however I am
>guilty of wishing it upon people. However cheesy I think the saying may be,
>Two Wrongs Do Not Make a Right. And you may find yourself on the receiving
>end of an intentional mob train by your last victim some time in the
future.
>
snip of story
>
>Just think twice before doing things like this. Not only is it possible to
>be banned (of course it's easier to get proof of this when you get a
>screenshot of the text a would-be mob-trainer sends as he is gloating over
>your corpse), you also risk the other party trying to exact revenge.
>Sometimes it fails (as in my case), but who knows when they will succeed?
>It's no fun trying to have a good time playing a game while someone is
>trying very hard to spoil it.
>
>Sartori D'Elsiraad
>Bard of Kelethin of the 16th Chorus
>Veeshan
>
